captions.text:
- Oh no!
(girl on left laughs)
This is awkward!

- No, there's no such
thing as a stupid question.
(playful percussion and piano music)

- We have all the answers
- All of them.

- [Voiceover] Why do you
take so long to get ready?
- No, not okay, are you serious?
- That's a stereotype.

- I know men that spend
hours getting their hair cut.
- I take about 15 minutes to get ready.
- I don't take long to get ready.
- I also don't take long to get ready.
- That's one I can't answer.

- But Linda here takes
forever to get ready.

- I do not leave the house
until I look damn good.

- Dudes are always like, "Oh,
I like a girl who's natural."

Buddy, if you saw me
natural, you would scream

like you were looking
at Freddy Krueger, okay?
You're like, "This is a natural look."
No it isn't.
- [Voiceover] What do periods feel like?

- Having a period is externally
having to look like this
at work and inside you're like...

(woman on left laughs)
(whispering) Fuck you too.
- Every month, I'll get a little bit sad
and I'll forget why, and I'll be like,

"What's wrong with me,
why am I so depressed?"
- [Both] And then the next day...
- I get my period.
- It feels like, "Oh, did I pee myself?"

And then you go to the
bathroom and you're like,
"No, just blood."
- The consistency of chocolate syrup
coming out of you, it's like gross.
- You just feel shitty.
- [Voiceover] Circumcised or not? Why?

- [Voiceover] No, I don't
wanna make anyone feel bad.

- I've never seen an
uncircumcised penis in real life.
- You can actually make the motion easier,
'cause there's more like...
(girl on left laughs)

Like...
- Yes?
- Everyone's genitals are beautiful, okay?
We live in a beautiful world of genitals.

- I don't have a hard
or fast rule, who cares?

- It really depends on the
person attached to the penis.

- [Voiceover] Why do
you hate bras so much?

- I feel like we don't have
to answer that question
as much as just give you a bra,

(girl on right laughs)
have you wear it for a day.
- Bras hurt.

- It's sweaty, it's
elastic, it has wire in it.

- I hate anything that's
gonna, like, constrict me
for eight hours.

- Why do you take off your
pants when you get home?

- If no one ever said we
have to cover these up,
I would have never worn one.

- [Voiceover] What do you
love most about being a woman?
Aww.
- A, being able to inspire other women.
- I love other women.

- The bond that women
have with each other.
- Yes!

- I think it's just amazing
that we can give life.
- It'll be really cool one day to be a mom
and hopefully have a daughter,
and that kind of a thing.

- I think I just love women,
so I like that I get to be one.
- If we need to continue the human race,

we don't really need men but
we definitely need women.
- What if you went to the bathroom,
and blood came out the tip of your dick?
And then you had to put paper over
the tip of your dick all day?
- Or a tiny, tiny tampon?
(synthy musical sting)

title: Women Answer Questions Men Are Too Afraid To Ask

On Equal rights for women:
Reproductive rights:
women- up to 20+weeks after conception to decide whether they want to be a

Men- (even if he has used a condom) his choice whether to be a parent ends 
the second the deed is done. If the woman chooses to keep a child that he

government will forcibly take as much of his check as they want to. if they 
can't do that they throw him in jail. And tax breaks? even if he supports 
the child over 50% he gets squat.

"wage gap":
Women: all hourly jobs pay the same for both.
Women tend to take positions with less pay and more flexibility in work 
hours.
Women with children have government guaranteed access to a portion of the 
fathers pay check, government assistance and ALL tax breaks associated with 
those children.
Men: tend to take higher paying positions that are physically harder, have 
longer hours, and or a more ridged work schedule.
Men with children also are required by law to  support them and get no tax 
breaks unless  other wise agreed or they are married to the mother.

Job protection:
Women: automatically a protected class based on sex
Men: denied protected class based on sex  

The ability to dress and act anyway you want (safety from attack)
neither sex can do completely as they please with out recourse; If a man

Periods basically feel like stomach cramps, it's not fun. It's different 
for all women but for me the cramps generally aren't too bad, but some days

like the day before you have your period you'll be crying and feeling 
really depressed about yourself or you'll feel more emotional for no real 
reason and you start crying at touching scenes during movies, then the next 
day you have your period.


Like that one girl said, you'll feel like a warm spurt like you peed 
yourself. You're constantly checking your pants to make sure no blood has 
dripped through and is showing itself to the world or, worse, getting on 
the seat you're sitting on, especially if you sit in a public place like 
school. Depending on the girl, you'll also have to take a shit which is 
gets rather messy when you're trying to wipe, since you're wiping both poo 
and blood. 


If you wear pads, it feels clunky and like you're wearing a diaper. On the 
bright side you get very used to seeing your own vagina and seeing blood so 
if you're squeamish about blood having a period every month will clear that 
right up. XD﻿
